title: ‘Opportunity Has Never Been Greater in Crypto’: Bitwise CIO Says Market Vastly Undervaluing Change in Washington
body: Bitwise chief investment officer (CIO) Matt Hougan says the crypto markets are undervaluing the US government’s policy shift on digital assets. In a new interview with Natalie Brunell, Hougan says that the buying opportunity in crypto is now one of the best ever as the regulatory landscape has dramatically shifted under US President Donald Trump. “I think the market is underpricing the change in Washington. That’s actually surprised me. I know that Bitcoin ripped from $70,000 to $100,000, but I think the change is much greater than that. I look at what’s happening, not just in Bitcoin, but in DeFi (decentralized finance), even in alt layer-1s, and I think the market is just underestimating the change. The reason for that is, I think, unless you worked in crypto over the last four years, you can’t imagine how challenging it was… You look at what’s happened at the SEC (U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission) recently, pulling back on the Coinbase lawsuit, pulling back on the Uniswap lawsuit, I think just the rebound for that is 2x to 3x more than what we’ve seen in the market so far. So I guess I’ve been surprised that people haven’t sort of felt and intuited that difference, but now I recognize it’s because they didn’t know how bad we had it, and so therefore how open the market is now.” Hougan says the crypto markets are exhibiting strong fundamentals and he predicts companies and sovereign wealth funds will increasingly buy Bitcoin ( BTC ). “I think it’s a great long-term buying opportunity. I saw a tweet yesterday from Avichal [Garg] from Electric Capital that said, ‘Opportunity is fundamentals, minus perception,’ and the opportunity has never been greater in crypto if you use that math… Every time you see another company say it’s putting Bitcoin on its balance sheet that’s going to be another sort of pebble in the pond that lifts the tide. So there’s going to be a lot of this sort of slow turn. I think if we do see more sovereigns come out, I think maybe that could be the spark or catalyst, but I think it’s more of a slow bull market.” Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Don't Miss a Beat – Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Bitcoin Miners Feel Squeeze as Hashprice Erases Post-Election Gains
body: Bitcoin miners are facing renewed financial pressure as declining transaction fees and a hashprice drop push operational costs higher, according to TheMinerMag’s February 2025 report​. Bitcoin’s hashrate climbed 3.8% in February to 810 EH/s, showing a slowdown in mining competition growth. However, the hashprice (the revenue that miners earn per unit of computing power) slipped to $45/PH/s, wiping out gains from the U.S. election-driven price surge. At this level, inefficient miners are feeling the strain. Transaction fees made up just 1.3% of total block rewards in February, marking their lowest share since the last bear market bottom in 2022. March is trending even lower, at 1.12% so far. These factors — alongside increased competition from artificial intelligence (AI) data centers — are putting extra pressure on mining operations who rely on hosting agreements and asset-light strategies. MARA remains the industry leader with 44 EH/s after a 6% hashrate increase, while CleanSpark grew 12% to 39 EH/s. Meanwhile, total bitcoin holdings among miners surpassed 100,000 BTC for the first time, despite some firms like HIVE Digital and Cipher Mining selling their production to fund expansion. Mining stocks took a hit, with the combined market capitalization of 15 major firms dropping from $36 billion in January to $22 billion in March. Cipher, Canaan, Hut 8, HIVE, and Bitdeer all saw losses exceeding 40%. With network growth slowing and energy costs rising, miners may need a Bitcoin price rally to avoid further financial strain. body: Disclosure: This article does not represent investment advice. The content and materials featured on this page are for educational purposes only. While Bitcoin took years for returns, Lightchain AI raises $17.9m in presale, offering faster growth and opportunity. Table of Contents Bitcoin’s beginnings: Gradual rise to wealth Lightchain AI: The gateway to crypto growth Why investors are buzzing about Lightchain AI’s potential for big gains When Bitcoin (BTC) first launched, early investors waited years to see substantial returns as the cryptocurrency gradually gained global recognition. Today, the crypto market moves at a much faster pace, with game-changing projects like Lightchain AI offering opportunities for quicker growth. With an impressive $17.9 million raised during its presale and tokens priced at just $0.007, Lightchain AI is positioning itself as a game-changer in the blockchain space, drawing the attention of investors eager for accelerated returns and innovation. You might also like: What sets Lightchain AI apart from Trump and Melania memecoins Bitcoin’s beginnings: Gradual rise to wealth Bitcoin, a digital currency, was unleashed on the world in 2009 by an anonymous individual or group known as Satoshi Nakamoto. Its initial front-line troops were the techies and free thinkers who saw the potential of virtual money that was completely independent of any government or financial institution. For the most part, those who risked their hard-earned money to buy Bitcoin in its’ early years took a leap of faith that they would come out as the ultimate winners ultimately. The fact that these were kinds of investments that traditional fund managers would have never been interested in did not stop the so-called technology geeks from placing their bet on the game-changing currency. The print press was rarely heard of in those days, so almost everyone had no idea what blockchain technology was. What is more, there were only a few places that could exchange the currency. By the way, a major part of the Android Bitcoin Wallets is the “Watch-only” feature, which allows people to generate a new address that will not be saved on the phone storage and to view their balance and transactions. Then the creation of the new address becomes an essential element on a phone. This will ensure privacy and security. The popularity of Bitcoin began to flourish as more and more businesses started to accept it as a mode of payment and the advent of exchanges. Through the sharp increases and slowdowns over the past few years, Bitcoin has managed to become a big financial market. Lightchain AI: The gateway to crypto growth Lightchain AI is changing the crypto space by combining advanced blockchain technology with artificial intelligence. Its AI-driven ecosystem processes complex computations in real-time, making it a powerful tool for industries like logistics, healthcare, and finance. This unique feature has already captured the attention of institutional investors and crypto whales. A standout achievement for Lightchain AI is its impressive presale, which has raised $17.9 million. With multi-chain compatibility and a focus on scalability, the platform integrates seamlessly with existing networks, paving the way for widespread adoption. title: Lazarus Group Moves $3.76M Bitcoin to Multiple Wallets
body: The Lazarus Group, a North Korean state-affiliated hacking syndicate, has recently made news by transferring significant Bitcoin. On-chain data shows that Lazarus Group moved $3.76 million worth of Bitcoin to several unknown addresses, bringing their total to 13,441 BTC, which is worth about $1.15 billion. Lazarus Group Laundering Scheme is Becoming Alarming On March 20, Lazarus Group made a significant transaction by sending 12.929 BTC (about $1.12 million) to an unknown wallet. They also targeted four other wallets, each receiving a different amount. Two unknown wallets received 0.308 BTC each, one received 14.849 BTC, and the last received 15.684 BTC. Lazarus moved 44.07 BTC to five different wallet addresses within three hours. This transaction undoubtedly shows that the Lazarus group is still laundering stolen cryptocurrency. Ben Zhou, Bybit’s CEO, commented on the situation, saying that the hackers might be using Bitcoin mixers to hide the origin of the funds. Meanwhile, the notorious Lazarus Group has been behind some of the biggest cyber attacks recently. This group often targets cryptocurrency exchanges , financial institutions, and government organizations. It holds a lot of Bitcoin and uses advanced methods to hide its actions and avoid detection. New Lazarus Malware Targets Developers and Wallets In addition to laundering stolen funds, the Lazarus Group launched a new malware campaign. Researchers discovered six malicious packages to infiltrate developer environments, steal credentials, extract crypto data, and install backdoors. The group’s latest attack method exploits the Node Package Manager (NPM) ecosystem, which JavaScript developers widely use. Hackers deceive developers into unknowingly downloading infected dependencies by employing typosquatting techniques–creating package names that closely resemble legitimate libraries. These malicious packages contained a new strain of malware, “BeaverTail.” The malware attempts to attract sensitive files from Google Chrome, Brave, and Firefox browsers while compromising macOS keychain data. Lazarus Group Remains a Threat It is worth noting that the Lazarus Group allegedly uses the stolen money to help North Korea’s weapons programs. The group has taken millions from significant crypto exchanges. In late June 2024, Alex Lab linked a $4M crypto hack to the notorious hacking group . In 2020, they attacked KuCoin and stole around $275 million. Similarly, the bad actors hacked the Ronin Network in 2022 and withdrew over $625 million worth of crypto assets. That same year, they stole nearly $100 million from Harmony’s Horizon Bridge. Authorities and blockchain firms are working hard to close these gaps. The post Lazarus Group Moves $3.76M Bitcoin to Multiple Wallets appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

title: Coinbase’s Bold Move: Demanding Crystal Clear Crypto Regulations from the SEC
body: In a significant move that could reshape the future of digital finance, Coinbase, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, is actively pressing the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to establish much-needed clarity in the realm of crypto regulations . This push comes at a crucial time, aligning with ongoing efforts within the U.S. Congress to bring structure and definition to the burgeoning digital asset space, as reported by The Block. Why is Coinbase Pushing for Crypto Regulations Now? The core of Coinbase’s appeal lies in the urgent need to define the SEC’s jurisdiction over digital assets . The current ambiguity is hindering market growth and creating uncertainty for businesses and investors alike. Coinbase believes that clear, well-defined rules are not just beneficial but essential for fostering a stable and thriving crypto ecosystem. Their recommendations to the SEC are strategically aimed at addressing these pain points and paving the way for responsible innovation. Here’s a breakdown of Coinbase’s key recommendations to the SEC: Distinguishing Digital Commodities from Securities: Coinbase emphasizes the critical need to differentiate between digital commodities and securities. This distinction is paramount because it dictates which regulatory framework applies to each type of digital asset. Clear definitions will prevent overregulation and encourage innovation in areas that do not inherently pose securities risks. Deferring to U.S. Congress on Regulatory Ambiguities: Recognizing the complexity of the digital asset landscape, Coinbase advocates for the SEC to defer to the U.S. Congress on areas where regulatory authority is unclear. This collaborative approach ensures that regulatory frameworks are developed with broad stakeholder input and are adaptable to the rapidly evolving nature of crypto. Recognizing Secondary Market Transactions of Digital Commodities: A key point in Coinbase’s recommendation is the assertion that secondary market transactions of digital commodities should not be classified as securities transactions. This distinction is vital for exchanges and trading platforms, as it would streamline operations and reduce unnecessary regulatory burdens on routine trading activities. Allowing Tokenization of Traditional Securities: Looking towards the future, Coinbase is advocating for the SEC to embrace the tokenization of traditional securities. Tokenization, the process of representing traditional assets on a blockchain, holds immense potential to increase market efficiency, liquidity, and accessibility. By allowing this, the SEC can position the U.S. at the forefront of financial innovation. The Shifting Sands of Regulatory Clarity: What Changed Under the Trump Administration? Coinbase’s proactive stance is partly influenced by the perceived shift in the SEC’s approach to crypto under the Trump administration. While the specifics of this shift may be debated, the underlying message from Coinbase is consistent: regardless of administrative changes, the need for regulatory clarity remains constant and critical. They are urging the SEC to move beyond reactive enforcement and towards proactive rule-making that provides businesses with a clear roadmap for compliance and innovation. Why Does Regulatory Clarity Matter for Market Growth and Stability? The absence of clear crypto regulations casts a long shadow over the digital asset market, creating several challenges: Stifled Innovation: Uncertainty breeds hesitation. Without clear rules, businesses are less likely to invest heavily in crypto-related ventures, fearing potential regulatory pitfalls down the line. This stifles innovation and prevents the industry from reaching its full potential. Investor Uncertainty: Both retail and institutional investors are wary of navigating a regulatory gray area. Clear rules would provide a framework for investor protection, increasing confidence and attracting more capital into the market. Market Instability: Regulatory ambiguity can contribute to market volatility. When the rules are unclear, market participants operate with less predictability, potentially leading to erratic price swings and instability. Hindered Institutional Adoption: Large institutional investors, who could inject significant capital into the crypto market, often require regulatory certainty before committing substantial resources. Clear rules are a prerequisite for broader institutional adoption. What Are the Potential Benefits of Clear Crypto Regulations? The benefits of establishing definitive crypto regulations are far-reaching and could positively impact various stakeholders: Benefit Description Increased Market Stability Clear rules reduce uncertainty, leading to more predictable market behavior and reduced volatility. Boosted Investor Confidence Defined regulations provide a safety net for investors, encouraging greater participation and investment. Accelerated Innovation Clarity empowers businesses to innovate within a defined framework, fostering growth and new applications. Attraction of Institutional Capital Regulatory certainty is crucial for attracting large institutional investors, unlocking significant capital inflows. Enhanced Consumer Protection Clear rules can incorporate measures to protect consumers from fraud and illicit activities within the crypto space. Coinbase’s Actionable Insights: A Roadmap for the SEC? Coinbase’s recommendations are not just complaints; they are actionable insights that offer a potential roadmap for the SEC to move forward. By focusing on distinguishing asset types, deferring to Congress where needed, and embracing innovation like tokenization , the SEC can create a regulatory environment that is both robust and conducive to growth. The ball is now in the SEC’s court to respond proactively and engage in constructive dialogue with industry leaders like Coinbase. Conclusion: A Pivotal Moment for Crypto Regulations Coinbase’s assertive push for regulatory clarity from the SEC marks a pivotal moment for the cryptocurrency industry in the United States. The exchange’s recommendations are timely, pragmatic, and address the core challenges hindering the sector’s progress. Whether the SEC will heed this call and usher in an era of well-defined crypto rules remains to be seen. However, one thing is certain: the industry is united in its demand for clarity, and this unified voice is becoming increasingly difficult to ignore. The future trajectory of the digital asset market in the U.S. may well depend on the SEC’s response to this critical juncture. title: BlackRock’s Cryptocurrency Head Talks About Ethereum As It Starts To Recover: “This Lacking for For Institutional Investorsto Step In”
body: BlackRock’s head of digital assets, Robert Mitchnick, believes staking could be a “major step change” for Ethereum exchange-traded funds (ETFs), potentially reviving investor interest in the asset class. Speaking at the Digital Asset Summit in New York, Mitchnick highlighted regulatory hurdles as a key factor limiting ETH ETF adoption. Since their launch in July 2024, Ethereum ETFs have struggled to gain traction compared to the explosive growth of Bitcoin ETFs. Mitchnick attributed this disparity to a common misconception about their success. However, he acknowledged that the inability of ETH ETFs to generate staking returns is a critical limitation holding them back. “There’s clearly a next level of potential development for Ethereum ETFs,” Mitchnick said. “The ETF has turned out to be a really compelling vehicle for holding Bitcoin for many different types of investors. There’s no question that it’s less perfect today for ETH without staking. Staking returns are a meaningful part of how you can generate ROI in this space, and not all ETH ETFs had staking when they launched.” Related News: Identity of Whale Who Leveraged 50x Leverage to Profit $20 Million in the Last Few Days Revealed Staking allows investors to earn passive returns by locking their cryptocurrency holdings on the network for a set period of time. However, regulatory complexities make integrating staking into ETFs a challenge. “This is not a particularly easy problem,” Mitchnick said. “This is not as simple as a new administration greenlighting something and then boom, we’re all good, we’re on the record. There are a lot of very complex challenges that need to be solved, but if this can be solved, it would be a step change upwards in terms of what we see activity around these products.” Despite the current challenges, Mitchnick remains optimistic about Ethereum's long-term potential. *This is not investment advice. title: Pump.fun launches native DEX dubbed PumpSwap
body: Pump.fun, the memecoin launchpad on the Solana, has announced the launch of PumpSwap, a native decentralized exchange promising instant token migration, zero fees and enhanced liquidity. The Pump.fun team unveiled the new DEX platform on March 20, 2025, noting in a post on X that PumpSwap will now support all launchpad coins that “complete their bonding curve.” PumpSwap, built on Solana ( SOL ), is a decentralized exchange protocol that will operate similarly to Raydium v4 and Uniswap v2, through its constant product automated market maker model. The launch of the new DEX platform allows users to create liquidity pools. Users can also add to existing pools as well as trade all PumpSwap tokens. “Why did we build this? From day 1, our goal was to create the most frictionless environment for trading coins. Migrations were a major point of friction – they slow a coin’s momentum and introduce needless complexity for new users,” Pump.fun wrote on X. The launch of PumpSwap introduces instant migrations, which the protocol says will be free, with the previous fee of six SOL for migration now removed. Seamless functionality also reduces complexity for new users. Initially, PumpSwap plans to levy a fee of 0.25% per trade, with most of it, 0.20%, going to liquidity providers. The other 0.05% will go to the protocol. Fee distribution will change once creator revenue sharing goes live. As well as memecoins, PumpSwap will offer access to several partner platform tokens, including Pudgy Penguins, Aptos and Tron, Jupiter, Sei and LayerZero. The DEX will also support Coinbase’s wrapped token cbBTC, Ethena Labs’s stablecoin USDe and Frax Finance’s frxUSD and FXS. Tron DAO posted on X: “TRON’s involvement in this initiative further strengthens its commitment to cross-chain innovation and the expansion of decentralized finance access. As PumpSwap grows, it aims to become a key liquidity hub, supporting on and off-ramps across multiple blockchains and driving broader adoption of Web3 technologies.” PumpSwap’s rollout comes just a day after Raydium ( RAY ) launched its own proprietary memecoin factory LaunchLab. The Pump.fun clone will offer the same token creation and launch features. Read more: Raydium launches Pump.fun clone, industry reception divided
